info.title: Application Insights Data Plane
info.description: This API exposes AI metric & event information and associated metadata

get.description: Gets OData EDMX metadata describing the event data model

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to get. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Name of the Application Insights application.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: Client API version.

get.description: Executes an OData query for events

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to get. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Name of the Application Insights application.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: The type of events to query; either a standard event type (`traces`, `customEvents`, `pageViews`, `requests`, `dependencies`, `exceptions`, `availabilityResults`) or `$all` to query across all event types.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: Optional. The timespan over which to retrieve events. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the Odata expression.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An expression used to filter the returned events

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description: A free-text search expression to match for whether a particular event should be returned

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of properties with \"asc\" (the default) or \"desc\" to control the order of returned events

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Limits the properties to just those requested on each returned event

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip over before returning events

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: The number of events to return

parameters.name: $format
parameters.description: Format for the returned events

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Request a count of matching items included with the returned events

parameters.name: $apply
parameters.description: An expression used for aggregation over returned events

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: Client API version.

get.description: Gets the data for a single event

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to get. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Name of the Application Insights application.

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: The type of events to query; either a standard event type (`traces`, `customEvents`, `pageViews`, `requests`, `dependencies`, `exceptions`, `availabilityResults`) or `$all` to query across all event types.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: Optional. The timespan over which to retrieve events. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the Odata expression.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: ID of event.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: Client API version.

get.description: Gets metadata describing the available metrics

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to get. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Name of the Application Insights application.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: Client API version.

get.description: Gets metric values for a single metric

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to get. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Name of the Application Insights application.

parameters.name: metricId
parameters.description: ID of the metric. This is either a standard AI metric, or an application-specific custom metric.

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: The timespan over which to retrieve metric values. This is an ISO8601 time period value. If timespan is omitted, a default time range of `PT12H` ("last 12 hours") is used. The actual timespan that is queried may be adjusted by the server based. In all cases, the actual time span used for the query is included in the response.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The time interval to use when retrieving metric values. This is an ISO8601 duration. If interval is omitted, the metric value is aggregated across the entire timespan. If interval is supplied, the server may adjust the interval to a more appropriate size based on the timespan used for the query. In all cases, the actual interval used for the query is included in the response.

parameters.name: aggregation
parameters.description: The aggregation to use when computing the metric values. To retrieve more than one aggregation at a time, separate them with a comma. If no aggregation is specified, then the default aggregation for the metric is used.

parameters.name: segment
parameters.description: The name of the dimension to segment the metric values by. This dimension must be applicable to the metric you are retrieving. To segment by more than one dimension at a time, separate them with a comma (,). In this case, the metric data will be segmented in the order the dimensions are listed in the parameter.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: The number of segments to return.  This value is only valid when segment is specified.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: The aggregation function and direction to sort the segments by.  This value is only valid when segment is specified.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: An expression used to filter the results.  This value should be a valid OData filter expression where the keys of each clause should be applicable dimensions for the metric you are retrieving.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: Client API version.

get.description: Executes an Analytics query for data

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to get. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Name of the Application Insights application.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Analytics query. Learn more about the [Analytics query syntax](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/app-insights-analytics-reference/)

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: Optional. The timespan over which to query data. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the query expression.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: Client API version.

post.description: Executes an Analytics query for data. [Here](https://dev.applicationinsights.io/documentation/Using-the-API/Query) is an example for using POST with an Analytics query.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group to get. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Name of the Application Insights application.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: Client API version.

requestBody.description: The Analytics query. Learn more about the [Analytics query syntax](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/app-insights-analytics-reference/)

applicationsParam.description: Application IDs to include in cross-application queries.

type.description: The data type of this column.

resources.description: Indicates resources which were responsible for the error.

target.description: Indicates which property in the request is responsible for the error.

value.description: Indicates which value in 'target' is responsible for the error.

errorInfo.title: The code and message for an error.

errorResponse.title: Error details.
errorResponse.description: Contains details when the response code indicates an error.

eventType.description: The type of events to query; either a standard event type (`traces`, `customEvents`, `pageViews`, `requests`, `dependencies`, `exceptions`, `availabilityResults`) or `$all` to query across all event types.

eventsAiInfo.description: AI related application info for an event result

eventsApplicationInfo.description: Application info for an event result

eventsApply.description: An expression used for aggregation over returned events

duration.description: The duration of the availability result

id.description: The ID of the availability result

location.description: The location of the availability result

message.description: The message of the availability result

name.description: The name of the availability result

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the availability result

size.description: The size of the availability result

success.description: Indicates if the availability result was successful

networkDuration.description: The network duration of the load

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the load

processingDuration.description: The processing duration of the load

receiveDuration.description: The receive duration of the load

sendDuration.description: The send duration of the load

totalDuration.description: The total duration of the load

countryOrRegion.description: Country or region of the client

stateOrProvince.description: State or province of the client

eventsClientInfo.description: Client info for an event result

name.description: The name of the client performance

eventsCloudInfo.description: Cloud info for an event result

eventsCount.description: Request a count of matching items included with the returned events

name.description: The name of the custom event

value.description: The value of the custom metric

valueStdDev.description: The standard deviation of the custom metric

valueSum.description: The sum of the custom metric

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the dependency

resultCode.description: The result code of the dependency

success.description: Indicates if the dependency was successful

id.description: The ID of the exception detail

message.description: The message of the exception detail

outerId.description: The outer ID of the exception detail

severityLevel.description: The severity level of the exception detail

assembly.description: The assembly of the stack entry

level.description: The level of the stack entry

line.description: The line of the stack entry

method.description: The method of the stack entry

assembly.description: The assembly which threw the exception

handledAt.description: Indicates where the exception was handled at

innermostAssembly.description: The inner most assembly of the exception

innermostMessage.description: The inner most message of the exception

innermostMethod.description: The inner most method of the exception

innermostType.description: The inner most type of the exception

method.description: The method that threw the exception

outerAssembly.description: The outer assembly of the exception

outerMessage.description: The outer message of the exception

outerMethod.description: The outer method of the exception

outerType.description: The outer type of the exception

problemId.description: The problem ID of the exception

severityLevel.description: The severity level of the exception

eventsFilter.description: An expression used to filter the returned events

eventsOperationInfo.description: Operation info for an event result

eventsOrderBy.description: A comma-separated list of properties with \"asc\" (the default) or \"desc\" to control the order of returned events

duration.description: The duration of the page view

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the page view

category.description: The category of the performance counter

counter.description: The counter of the performance counter

instance.description: The instance of the performance counter

instanceName.description: The instance name of the performance counter

name.description: The name of the performance counter

value.description: The value of the performance counter

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the request

resultCode.description: The result code of the request

success.description: Indicates if the request was successful

id.description: The unique ID for this event.

@odata.context.description: OData context metadata endpoint for this response

value.description: Contents of the events query result.

eventsSearch.description: A free-text search expression to match for whether a particular event should be returned

eventsSelect.description: Limits the properties to just those requested on each returned event

eventsSessionInfo.description: Session info for an event result

eventsSkip.description: The number of items to skip over before returning events

eventsTimespan.description: Optional. The timespan over which to retrieve events. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the Odata expression.

eventsTop.description: The number of events to return

eventsUserInfo.description: User info for an event result

metricId.description: ID of the metric. This is either a standard AI metric, or an application-specific custom metric.

metricsAggregation.description: The aggregation to use when computing the metric values. To retrieve more than one aggregation at a time, separate them with a comma. If no aggregation is specified, then the default aggregation for the metric is used.

metricsFilter.description: An expression used to filter the results.  This value should be a valid OData filter expression where the keys of each clause should be applicable dimensions for the metric you are retrieving.

metricsInterval.description: The time interval to use when retrieving metric values. This is an ISO8601 duration. If interval is omitted, the metric value is aggregated across the entire timespan. If interval is supplied, the server may adjust the interval to a more appropriate size based on the timespan used for the query. In all cases, the actual interval used for the query is included in the response.

metricsOrderBy.description: The aggregation function and direction to sort the segments by.  This value is only valid when segment is specified.

id.description: An identifier for this query.  Must be unique within the post body of the request.  This identifier will be the 'id' property of the response object representing this query.

parameters.description: The parameters for a single metrics query

interval.description: The interval used to segment the metric data.

id.description: The specified ID for this metric.

status.description: The HTTP status code of this metric query.

metricsSegment.description: The name of the dimension to segment the metric values by. This dimension must be applicable to the metric you are retrieving. To segment by more than one dimension at a time, separate them with a comma (,). In this case, the metric data will be segmented in the order the dimensions are listed in the parameter.

end.description: Start time of the metric segment (only when an interval was specified).

start.description: Start time of the metric segment (only when an interval was specified).

metricsTimespan.description: The timespan over which to retrieve metric values. This is an ISO8601 time period value. If timespan is omitted, a default time range of `PT12H` ("last 12 hours") is used. The actual timespan that is queried may be adjusted by the server based. In all cases, the actual time span used for the query is included in the response.

metricsTop.description: The number of segments to return.  This value is only valid when segment is specified.

queryParam.description: The Analytics query. Learn more about the [Analytics query syntax](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/app-insights-analytics-reference/)

queryResults.title: A query response.

tables.description: The list of tables, columns and rows.

queryResults.description: Contains the tables, columns & rows resulting from a query.

queryTimespan.description: Optional. The timespan over which to query data. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the query expression.

table.title: A query response table.

columns.description: The list of columns in this table.

rows.description: The resulting rows from this query.

table.description: Contains the columns and rows for one table in a query response.
